description.raw:
* Make skin not required so we can specify trajectories for simple links without skeletons, see [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=actor&branch=actor) tutorial draft, which goes with Gazbeo branch [generalize_actor](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/generalize_actor%0Ddefault#diff) I'm not sure if this breaks API for sdf 1.6, it's just making something which was `required="1"` into `required="0"`

* Make animation not required, so if we specify a skin file which has an animation, that animation is used. In fact, this is already the behaviour in Gazebo, but when an animation is not defined, we check that its name is `__default__` instead of checking that `sdf->HasElement`.

* Documented all fields for the actor tag, please improve the documentation directly in this PR if something sounds weird or wrong.
description.html:
• Make skin not required so we can specify trajectories for simple links without skeletons, see this tutorial draft, which goes with Gazbeo branch generalize_actor I'm not sure if this breaks API for sdf 1.6, it's just making something which was required="1" into required="0"

  • Make animation not required, so if we specify a skin file which has an animation, that animation is used. In fact, this is already the behaviour in Gazebo, but when an animation is not defined, we check that its name is __default__ instead of checking that sdf->HasElement.

  • Documented all fields for the actor tag, please improve the documentation directly in this PR if something sounds weird or wrong.

title.raw: Document actor, make skin and animation optional
